Toronto-TMC: Cable chamber and duct installations on Bremner Blvd. at Spadina Ave to Rees St.

Toronto-TMC: Completing work for COT Project - 25ECS-RD-102LR. Sidewalks will be closed one at a time, always allowing pedestrians to have access down the road. Paving closures will allow local traffic at all times. Recon & Paving closures will be set up once per activity and drivable lane will be provided outside of work areas during recon. For paving closure will be set up and removed at end of day. Metrolinx Permits attached. Updated TCP attached. Access will be maintained at all times for residents. TCP & Cut permits attached.

Toronto-TMC: Surveying of monitoring points across the OTG Corridor. Intermittent and VSD closures assisted by a PDO/vehicle and signalized work vehicle. Evening work hours, Sunday - Friday nights (9pm-6am), excluding holidays. This permit has expired -- an extended permit has been requested.

Toronto-TMC: Form 1H - Application for work initiated by Hydro Only Permit Status: Approved

Toronto-TMC: Beginning midnight on Saturday, Dec. 6, the Osgoode Station Team plans to close Simcoe St. for works related to the Osgoode Station South Shaft. This closure is expected to remain in place for 48 hours. All closures will be off the road by midnight on Dec. 7, per the permit requirement. Two paid duty officers will be present on site while the road is closed to help redirect traffic and pedestrians.
Toronto-TMC: Form 1SOP - Application for work requiring a SOP (Street occupation permit) Permit Status: Approved

Toronto-TMC: Osgoode Station Site Staging. One southbound lane closed along Simcoe St. between Queen St. W. and the Simcoe Laneway. Northbound University Ave. lanes shifted west to accommodate north shaft piling work. RoDARS to extend site staging. Extended permit not yet issued but has been requested.
